title: Why are people crying for Ahri nerfs now?
body:
I will preempt this thread by saying yes, I am an Ahri main. She is the perfect champion for me. Started playing in Season 5 sometime between Bard and Ekko, but didn't start playing Ahri until last season.

Why are people crying for nerfs now? The only thing I remember about her being changed was her base mana pool which occurred in the Mage update and a nerf in that her E no longer stops dashes. Yes, she was picked in the LCS, but it's because she's safe. Look at the consistent pool of midlaners in LCS: Orianna, Viktor, and now Ahri. What makes her so good is that the other champs who were OP were nerfed. LB nerfed, Ryze nerfed, Jayce nerfed. Right now, Syndra is popular. Ahri happens to do well into Syndra because Ahri is good at dodging skillshots, which her entire kit is based around.

Yes, Ahri is a safe, mobile champ, but is balanced around that. She's always been a safe pick. And there's nothing wrong with having a few champs who can do a lot, but not specialize in any of those tasks.

Ahri is mostly strong due to the champions that do well against her being weakened. 

Ahri used to be very weak to Syndra (extremely squishy versus Syndra's targeted R, if you didn't rush MR you got 100-0'd easily at 6). Syndra has seen some damage nerfs which helped Ahri though. Likewise as you mentioned LeBlanc got nerfed (or banned out). Ahri's worst matchups being removed made room for her to shine (so she was always strong, and got indirectly stronger through enemy nerfs). 

I don't think she's OP, I actually think she's really balanced in that she actually makes a lot of real sacrifices to be a jack-of-all-trades. She truly is a master of none. Her mobility is good but not great (ultimate has a long cool down and Q MS isn't nearly as impactful as a dash would be). Her damage is moderate (no where near the burst of assassins or burst mages). Her CC is moderate-weak (a 0.75 second charm that has short range and is intercepted by minions, probably the weakest CC duration to difficulty-to-land CC in the game). Her kit works really well together to allow her to make plays (i.e. her R-E or F-E combo makes that difficult to land CC a lot easier) while simultaneously punishing her for misplaying / allows enemies to punish her if they outplay (she blows a huge cool down if her opponent dodges the E). 

I can't think of any other champion that has to blow their ultimate or flash in order to go for a play that the enemy can avoid without flashing themselves. You won't dodge an Annie's F-R unless you F because it's instant, for example. On the other spectrum, Syndra won't R you until she's successfully landed the Q-W-E (or just has you low enough to kill). Most champions can hold on to their power until they're certain it will work, while Ahri has to take a real risk to go for her chance. I think that's a hell of a lot more balanced than the other stuff out there. 

So the question really just comes down to numbers for me. I'm cool with the idea of nerfing her Q MS at early ranks so she doesn't have so much ability to dodge in lane (although it will take getting used to, as I love when a Blitz tries to invade and I Q him and the MS lets me outrange his hook, nerf it at all and I'll get caught!). My suggestion was to make it give less when going out and more when coming back (so it's equally good when kiting/fleeing but much worse when chasing). Her damage is too low for it to see nerfs, unless they nerf the early W damage and make it scale back up with ranks (i.e. force her to max W second so she can't get a more useful CC by giving charm a couple extra ranks first) (Bjergsen levelled charm to 2 at level 8 and 3 at level 10 before maxing W the last game he played her, for example). 

Which isn't to say I think she needs nerfs. She's just a safe generalist pick that works with a lot of team comps, so players who stick with her are rewarded more than people who stick to other champions (as those champs have situations where they work much worse with certain team comps). That's not a fault of champion balance, it's a fault of it being more rewarding to main Ahri than another champion from a reliability perspective, which is just sort of "tough grapes, that's how it is". It's the benefit of playing a champion that offers a bit of everything.

Ahri was in a shitty state during S4, She wasn't gutted but she wasn't good either, she was simply just there.

Some backstory, Ahri's FoxFire(W) got nerfed(After Worlds S3), Each extra Fox Fire hitting the same target gets -20% Damage. So to make up for this nerf they added the Kiss of Death. Keep in mind a lot of Ahri's power was balanced around DFG and she still wasn't that strong, this was when she wasn't very good. Once DFG was removed, they also removed the kiss of death, to compensate they buff the Charm Base/AP Scaling, and added in the MS speed to her Orb. Somewhere between now and then they buffed her Orb(Q) Mana (right before S5 when the MS was added) and nerfed (Last Summer) how her charm works with dashes.

If you remove the MS you will need to add something else or up her Base/Scaling. Ahri isn't nearly as oppressive as most other "overpowered" Mid laners where. She simply just doesn't have bad match ups and most of them are more or less skill oriented. She does have some strong match ups that harder for her to lose but she has some weaker ones to that she can win if your simply better then the opponent. 

On the latter part of your post, Lets say Tali uses her W to shove Ahri in a direction, If Ahri stops to cast her Orb for the MS she would still get hit by the Tali W. Where as a dash will simply act instantly and they don't get hit buy it. Also easier to dodge a skill shot with a dash then a MS steroid.
